newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Baobab raises stake in Mustek.
newsitem.headline: Baobab raises stake in Mustek.

text.p: Baobab Solid Growth Ltd said on Friday it had exchanged its shareholdings in Brother Business Machines Ltd and Hi-Technology Supply Co Ltd for 110,000 shares in Mustek Electronics Ltd.
Baobab will also swap certain rights to prperty interests distributed by Mustek to its shareholders.
The exchange will raise Baobab's stake in Mustek to 39.93 percent from a current 26 percent. The transactions have effect from July 1, 1996.
Over the past twelve months, Baobab has injected 37.5 million rand into Mustek, which will be listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange in March 1997.
Baobab said the swap transations would have no effect on its earnings as it does not equity account Mustek's earnings.

It said the transactions did not related to a cautionary announcement made on November 6. Shareholders were therefore advised to continue to exercise caution in their sharedealings. A detailed announcement was expected to be made early next year.
